author: pk910
content:
we've rolled the geth & grandine nodes.
looks like the geth pairs are stuck now and don't produce blocks anymore. do they need a resync?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Interesting, do you have some logs?

content: `ssh devops@teku-geth-1.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io`

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: `ERROR[01-21|13:51:13.554] Failed to build payload                  err="invalid timestamp, parent 1737467472 given 1737467460"`

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: It's weird, were only getting empty blocks on the CL, so there is no execution happening on the el

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Teku logs

author: pk910
content: geth was the only client working on that chain with ~30%.  Rolling all geth clients killed block production

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I restarted <@712394671959048244> now, but it seems like they don't pass us a NewPayload only an FCU, so we can not start our sync

author: parithosh
content: give it a bit, should kick into opt sync mode in 120 slots latest

author: tbenr
content: if there are no blocks to import, we just send FCU

author: tbenr
content: that exception isnt important (just complaining about head too old to contribute to sync committee)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Ah yeah, you're sending an FCU for the same head over and over

author: tbenr
content:
while this `invalid timestamp, parent 1737467472 given 1737467460` is interesting.
so there was an attempt to go backward in time WRT block production?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: yes

author: tbenr
content: i'll check the snooper

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: This was the teku log from that

author: tbenr
content: what a mess!

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Seems like it synced now?

author: tbenr
content: I suspect the node was suffering a lot and it essentially imported block at slot 36101 while still trying to produce block at 36100, then we messed up while trying to recover the situation

author: tbenr
content: teku-geth-4 came across the same hard times and recovered. teku-geth-1 had the edge case of block production in the middle of the madness

author: tbenr
content: yes everithing seems good now

author: parithosh
content: I guess prysm-geth will also slowly come back online

author: parithosh
content: <@504202741933932544> can you have a look at teku-nethermind-1 ? it seems to be stuck on an invalid block and not moving forward

author: parithosh
content: I ran a bunch of restarts and that seems to have helped a bit, we're at ~40%+ now. Could the missing nodes get some attention from CL teams? it isn't clear what's broken right now

author: tbenr
content:
apparently the node was stuck on importing a non-canonical block. The last fully imported block was at slot 29812. From there I see the all blocks have been imported optimistically (nethermind synching?)

Problem is that I can find anything on the snooper around that slot.. seems too old stuff

author: tbenr
content:
the interesting thing is:
```
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "result": {
    "status": "INVALID",
    "latestValidHash": "0x817aebdd1423819983e3c76029f7932af641ce0267fab7a4defa6ef8dd011a2d",
    "validationError": "Block 24133 (0x486e73...61d1c2) is known to be a part of an invalid chain."
  },
  "id": 8646
}
```

so nethermind reports 0x817aebdd1423819983e3c76029f7932af641ce0267fab7a4defa6ef8dd011a2d (which is the canonical block at slot 29766) to be the latest valid, but from teku's forkchoice dump I see several other canonical blocks imported succesfully after thatn one.
Funny.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: cache = bad

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I knew that this will bit us back when the spec required us to keep track of "invalid" blocks

author: tbenr
content: btw `Block 24133 (0x486e73...61d1c2)` seems to be orphaned so i guess imported correctly on other clients

author: marekm3498
content:
<@360491619402776577> <@504202741933932544> so it worked perfectly as it should. 

Nethermind said that the LVH is 0x817aebdd1423819983e3c76029f7932af641ce0267fab7a4defa6ef8dd011a2d and this block was indeed canonical, but Nethermind rejected block https://explorer.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/block/0x486e73c52a87d13b381a25370d62e34e6961fac91f87822f1c3bd24a0c61d1c2 which is not canonical and was reorged likely after geth fix

0x486e73c52a87d13b381a25370d62e34e6961fac91f87822f1c3bd24a0c61d1c2
